c74object.name: hirt.irmaker~
c74object.digest: HIRT Impulse Response Maker - Impulse Response Measurement and Auditioning
c74object.description: The hirt.irmaker~ can be used to measure the impulse responses of real spaces, software, or hardware devices, for use in hirt.convolver~ and hirt.convolutionreverb~ and throughout the HIRT package ecosystem and beyond. Measurements can be made using either an exponential sweep (most suitable for real spaces and analog equipment), or an impulse (most suited to measuring digital systems). Once measured, the impulse responses can be saved to disk.

inlet.description: Left Audio Signal to be measured and/or auditioned / Messages to hirt.irmaker~
Right Audio Signal to be measured and/or auditioned / Messages to hirt.irmaker~

outlet.digest: The Left measurement signal output (connect to measurement target)
The Right measurement signal output (connect to measurement target)
The Left auditioning outlet (connect to dac)
The Right auditioning outlet (connect to dac)

method.name: centre
method.digest: Audition response of Both input channels
method.description:
The symbol centre alone auditions the response of the recorded IR to a single sample click in both input channels.
If no IR has been recorded centre is ignored.

method.name: close
method.description: The symbol close (or wclose) will cause the currently open UI editor window to close.

method.name: impulse
method.description:
The symbol impulse alone measures using an impulse signal with the current settings.
The impulse signal is advisable for measurements within a digital system.

method.name: left
method.digest: Audition response of Left input channel
method.description:
The symbol left alone auditions the response of the recorded IR to a single sample click in the left input channel.
If no IR has been recorded left is ignored.

method.name: open
method.description: The symbol open (or front) will cause the UI editor window to open.

method.name: right
method.digest: Audition response of Right input channel
method.description:
The symbol right alone auditions the response of the recorded IR to a single sample click in the right input channel.
If no IR has been recorded right is ignored.

method.name: save
method.digest: Save currently recorded IR to disk
method.description:
The symbol save alone brings up a dialog in order to name and write the currently recorded IR to disk.
If no IR has been recorded save is ignored.

method.name: settings
method.description:
Syntax: settings <int: channels> [<int/float: amplitude>] [<int/float: sweeptime>] [<int/float: irlength>]
The message settings followed by a list of up to 4 atoms sets all IR Measurement parameters in one place.
Atom 1 corresponds exactly to the channels attribute.
Atom 2 corresponds exactly to the amplitude attribute.
Atom 3 corresponds exactly to the sweeptime attribute.
Atom 4 corresponds exactly to the irlength attribute.

method.name: signal
method.digest: In either inlet: The Audio signals to be measured and/or auditioned
method.description: In the Left inlet: The Left signal to be measured and/or auditioned. In the Right inlet: The Right signal to be measured and/or auditioned.

method.name: stop
method.description:
The symbol stop alone cancels any sweep or impulse measurement currently in progress.
Measurement progress is available as a 0..1 signal from the far right outlet of the abstraction.

method.name: sweep
method.description:
The symbol sweep alone measures using a sweep signal with the current settings.
The sweep signal is advisable for measuring analog equipment or real spaces.

attribute.name: amplitude
attribute.description:
Sets the output amplitude of the recorded IR.
A zero-indexed integer sets one of the following options:
0 = 0dB
1 = -5dB
2 = -10dB
3 = -15dB
4 = -20dB
5 = -25dB
6 = -30dB
A positive or negative float sets the dB value directly, always rounded to the nearest value in the list above.

attribute.name: audition
attribute.description: A 0/1 off/on flag allows recorded IRs to be auditioned. This may be done either by convolution with the input of hirt.irmaker~ (see also the input attribute flag), or by using the left, centre or right messages.

attribute.name: channels
attribute.description:
An integer selects either a true stereo mode (0), or a mono to stereo mode (1).
In use, the true stereo mode takes two measurements one after the other (one for each input channel). This allows the stereo response of a system to be properly recreated.
Only a single measurement is required for mono to stereo mode, but the true stereo response is not captured in this case.

attribute.name: input
attribute.description: A 0/1 off/on flag switches auditioning between using the left, centre & right messages only or using the audio input of the abstraction (see also the audition attribute flag).

attribute.name: irlength
attribute.description:
Sets the expected IR length. If in doubt this value should be over-estimated, to avoid cropping the end of the IR.
A zero-indexed integer sets one of the following options:
0 = 1 second
1 = 2 seconds
2 = 3 seconds
3 = 4 seconds
4 = 5 seconds
5 = 7.5 seconds
6 = 10 seconds
7 = 15 seconds
8 = 20 seconds
9 = 30 seconds
A float sets the seconds value directly, always rounded to the nearest value in the list above.

attribute.name: sweeptime
attribute.description:
Sets the sweep length in seconds. Longer sweeps produce higher quality results with a higher SNR.
A zero-indexed integer sets one of the following options:
0 = 10 seconds (quick measure)
1 = 15 seconds (low quality)
2 = 20 seconds (medium quality)
3 = 30 seconds (good quality)
4 = 45 seconds (high quality)
5 = 60 seconds (very high quality)
A float sets the seconds value directly, always rounded to the nearest value in the list above.

attribute.name: tone
attribute.description: A 0/1 off/on flag switches test tones off/on. Use test tones to set recording levels. See also tonechans and tonefreq attributes.

attribute.name: tonechans
attribute.description:
An integer selects which channels will output a test tone when engaged (see the tone attribute).
0 = Both channels
1 = Left channel
2 = Right channel

attribute.name: tonefreq
attribute.description:
Sets the test tone frequency.
A zero-indexed integer sets one of the following options:
0 = 32 Hz
1 = 64 Hz
2 = 125 Hz
3 = 250 Hz
4 = 500 Hz
5 = 1 kHz
6 = 2 kHz
7 = 4 kHz
8 = 8 kHz
9 = 16 kHz
A float sets the Hz (not kHz) value directly, always rounded to the nearest value in the list above.

attribute.name: trimnorm
attribute.description:
A 0/1 off/on flag switches automatic trimming & normalisation off/on.
When on, recorded IRs will be normalised and automatically trimmed when saved. Otherwise IRs are left exactly as measured. (See also the save message).

c74object.discussion: Based on the original Ableton 'IR Measurement Device' device programmed by Alex Harker. 2018 MSP port by Pete Dowling. To explore the abstraction either right-click an instantiated abstraction and choose "Object > Open Original...", or open the original '.maxpat' from the Max Browser. After this, cmnd/ctrl-e to go into edit mode, then cmnd/ctrl-click the "View" button.
